Name: Understanding the entity and its context - Interested parties
Description: The entity shall determine interested parties that are relevant to its information security.

Name: Understanding the entity and its context - Requirements of interested parties
Description: The entity shall determine the requirements of these interested parties.

Name: Understanding the entity and its context - Sector or national context
Description: The entity shall determine factors related to its sector or national context.

Name: Understanding the entity and its context - Internal Capabilities
Description: The entity shall determine its internal capabilities.

Name: Understanding the entity and its context - Organizational structure
Description: The entity shall determine its organizational structure.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Information security policy & objectives
Description: Top management commitment shall ensure the information security policy and the information security objectives are established and are compatible with the strategic direction of the entity.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Integration of information security requirements into processes
Description: Top management commitment shall ensure the integration of the information security requirements into the entity's processes.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Availability of resources
Description: Top management commitment shall ensure that the resources needed for information security are available.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Communicate importance of effectiveness
Description: Top management commitment shall communicate the importance of the effectiveness of information security management.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Direct & support
Description: Top management commitment shall direct and support persons to contribute to the effectiveness of information security and conforming to the requirements of these Standards.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Continual improvement
Description: Top management commitment shall promote continual improvement.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Support other roles
Description: Top management commitment shall support other relevant management roles to demonstrate their leadership as it applies to their areas of responsibility.

Name: Leadership and management commitment - Participate in reviews
Description: Top management commitment shall give direction to and participating in reviews of information security, including risks, controls and effectiveness, on a high level.

Name: Roles and responsibilities for information security - Assign responsibilities and authorities
Description: Top management shall assign the responsibility and the authority for ensuring that the information security implemented in the entity conforms to the requirements of the UAE IA Regulation.

Name: Roles and responsibilities for information security - Information security performance reporting
Description: Top management shall assign the responsibility and the authority for reporting on the performance of information security to top management.

Name: Roles and responsibilities for information security - Appoint Information Security Manager
Description: Top management shall ensure that an Information Security Manager is appointed to take overall responsibility for the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of information security.

Name: Roles and responsibilities for information security - Establish Information Security Committee
Description: Top management shall ensure that an Information Security Committee is established that oversees and governs the establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of information security in the entity, and that integrates information security in the entity.

Name: Information security policy - Appropriateness
Description: The Information Security Policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Information security policy - Framework for objectives
Description: The Information Security Policy shall provide the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives.

Name: Information security policy - Commitment to satisfy requirements
Description: The Information Security Policy shall include a commitment to satisfy all applicable information security requirements.

Name: Information security policy - Commitment to continual improvement
Description: The Information Security Policy shall include a commitment to continual improvement of the information security management system.

Name: Information security policy - Available as a document
Description: The Information Security Policy shall be documented.

Name: Information security policy - Maintenance, review, and update
Description: The Information Security Policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Supporting policies for information security -Define, approve, and publish
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall be defined, approved, published and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Cover all aspects of information security
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall address all aspects of information security that are included in this Standard, based on the risk assessment.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Sector specific requirements
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall address sector-specific regulations and standards.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Suitable
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall be suitable to the entity and shall have a clearly identified audience.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Reflect implementation
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall reflect the implementation the entity has chosen and shall not include any statements the entity does not comply with.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Top management commitment
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall include commitment of the Top Management.

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Available as a document
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall be documented

Name: Supporting policies for information security - Maintenance, review, and update
Description: The set of supporting information security polices shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Authorization process for information systems - Define and implement
Description: The entity shall define and implement a management authorization process for new information systems.

Name: Authorization process for information systems - Regulate
Description: The entity shall regulate the use of personal information systems for processing business information.

Name: Confidentiality agreements - Define a template
Description: The entity shall define a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) template to be used to legally protect confidential information and ownership of information.

Name: Confidentiality agreements - Information classification process
Description: The entity shall have an information classification process in place to identify which information is subject to the terms of the NDA.

Name: Confidentiality agreements - Track all signed NDAs
Description: The entity shall keep a track record of all signed NDAs and perform a periodical review.

Name: Contact with authorities - Identify relevant authorities
Description: The entity shall identify all relevant national authorities, including sector specific regulators.

Name: Contact with authorities - Identify a point of contact
Description: The entity shall identify a Point of Contact in the Entity and communicate his/her name to the identified authorities, if required or allowed.

Name: Contact with authorities - Establish a policy
Description: The entity shall establish a policy to determine when and how to engage with relevant authorities.

Name: Contact with special interest groups - Identify interest groups
Description: The entity shall identify all relevant national and international interest groups or working groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

Name: Contact with special interest groups - Allocate resources
Description: The entity shall allocate the right resources in order to properly support the group.

Name: Contact with special interest groups - Define what is allowed to share
Description: The entity shall define what participating employees are allowed to share.

Name: Contact with special interest groups - Interest group sharing rules
Description: The entity shall allow sharing and circulation of information inside the entity, as permitted by interest group rules.

Name: Identification of risks related to external parties - Identify risks
Description: The entity shall identify risks to its information and information systems and implement the appropriate controls before granting access to any external party.

Name: Identification of risks related to external parties - Access policy
Description: The entity shall define an external party access policy.

Name: Identification of risks related to external parties - Adopt controls
Description: The entity shall identify and adopt proper controls to limit physical and logical access to information assets and entity information systems.

Name: Identification of risks related to external parties - Monitor access
Description: The entity shall monitor external party access to entity information and entity information systems.

Name: Addressing security when dealing with customers - Compliance
Description: The entity shall make sure that any customer accessing entity information and information systems are compliant with the entity's information security policy and security requirements.

Name: Addressing security when dealing with customers - Monitor access
Description: The entity shall monitor any customer access and verify compliance to agreed access control policy.

Name: Addressing security in third-party agreements - Requirements in contracts
Description: The entity shall verify that any contract or agreement with third parties addresses all aspects of the entity's information security policy regarding accessing, processing, communicating or managing the entity's information or information systems, or adding products or services to information systems.

Name: Addressing security in third-party agreements - Controls in contracts
Description: The entity shall make sure that proper controls are introduced in the contract in order to verify compliance with the agreed security objectives.

Name: Addressing security in third-party agreements - Audit
Description: The entity shall perform audit of third parties services and infrastructures to verify compliance with agreed security objectives.

Name: Resources - Adequate number of resources
Description: The entity shall ensure that the amount of human and financial resources provided shall be adequate for the work to be carried out for information security.

Name: Resources - Competency requirements
Description: The entity shall determine the necessary competence of person(s) doing work under its control that affects its information security performance.

Name: Resources - Competency assessment
Description: The entity shall ensure that these persons are competent on the basis of appropriate education, training, or experience.

Name: Resources - Competency improvement
Description: The entity shall where applicable, take actions to acquire the necessary competence, and evaluate the effectiveness of the actions taken.

Name: Resources - Evidence of competence
Description: The entity shall retain appropriate documented information as evidence of competence.

Name: Internal and external communication - Communication plan
Description:
The entity shall determine:     

A. On what to communicate      

B. When to communicate      

C. With whom to communicate      

D. Who shall communicate      

E. The processes by which communication shall be effected.

Name: Internal and external communication - Communication with UAE government entities
Description: The entity shall ensure that adequate communication can be maintained with the designated UAE Government entities.

Name: Internal and external communication - Available as a document
Description: The entity shall document the communication plan.

Name: Documentation - Approval of documents
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents are approved prior to issue.

Name: Documentation - Review of documents
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents are reviewed and updated as necessary.

Name: Documentation - Version control
Description: The entity shall ensure that changes and the current revision status of documents are identified.

Name: Documentation - Clear and identifiable
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents remain legible and readily identifiable

Name: Documentation - Available
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents are available to those who need them, are transferred, and stored in accordance with the procedures applicable to their classification.

Name: Documentation - Disposal
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents are disposed of in accordance with the procedures applicable to their classification.

Name: Documentation - External Origin
Description: The entity shall ensure that documents of external origin are identified.

Name: Documentation - Distribution
Description: The entity shall ensure that the distribution of documents is controlled.

Name: Documentation - Update
Description: The entity shall ensure that the unintended use of obsolete documents is prevented, and that up to date versions are available.

Name: Documentation - Retention
Description: The entity shall ensure that suitable identification is applied to documents if they are retained for any purpose.

Name: Documentation - Reference to regulation
Description: The entity shall document the compliance with the 'mandatory' controls in a way that allows unique reference to the requirements of this Regulation.

Name: Information security risk management policy - UAE IA's Issuances
Description: The information security risk management policy shall take into account relevant UAE IA's issuances in regard to risk management.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Documented and approved
Description: The information security risk management policy shall be documented and formally approved.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Address scope of services and functions
Description: The information security risk management policy shall addresses the purpose and scope of critical services and their supporting functions.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Information asset categorization
Description: The information security risk management policy shall categorize Information Asset based on its criticality.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The information security risk management policy shall addresses roles and responsibilities of the risk assessment team involved.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Risk acceptance criteria
Description: The information security risk management policy shall establish and maintain information security basic criteria, including the risk acceptance criteria, impact criteria, and risk evaluation criteria.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Risk treatment strategy
Description: The information security risk management policy shall contain a risk treatment strategy.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Risk monitoring and review strategy
Description: The information security risk management policy shall contain a risk monitoring and review strategy.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Criteria for performing, review and update
Description: The information security risk management policy shall determine the criteria for performing, reviewing and updating information security risk assessments.

Name: Information security risk management policy - Consistent, valid and comparable
Description: The information security risk management policy shall ensure that repeated information security risk assessments produce consistent, valid and comparable results.

Name: Information security risk identification - Risks associated with CIA
Description: The entity shall apply the information security risk assessment process to identify risks associated with the loss of confidentiality, integrity and availability for its information by: ' Define the scope of the risk assessment exercise ' Identify critical business functions ' Identify critical information systems supporting business critical functions within the scope and boundary of the risk assessment ' Identifying vulnerabilities related to the information and information systems ' Identify existing information security controls ' Identifying threats and threat sources

Name: Information security risk identification - Identify risk owners
Description: The entity shall identify the risk owners.

Name: Information security risk identification - Document risk identification results
Description: The entity shall document the results of the risk identification.

Name: Information security risk analysis - Assess potential consequences
Description: The entity shall assess the potential consequences that would result if the identified risks were to materialize by assessing the consequences of losses of confidentiality, integrity or availability.

Name: Information security risk analysis - Assess likelihood
Description: The entity shall assess the realistic likelihood of the occurrence of the identified risks based on the existing controls, identified vulnerabilities and threats.

Name: Information security risk analysis - Determine the level of risks
Description: The entity shall determine the levels of risk.

Name: Information security risk analysis - Document risk analysis results
Description: The entity shall document the results of the risk analysis.

Name: Information security risk evaluation - Compare risks with criteria
Description: The entity shall compare the analyzed risks with the risk criteria established in the information security risk management policy.

Name: Information security risk evaluation - Priorities for treatment
Description: The entity shall establish priorities for treatment of the identified risks.

Name: Information security risk evaluation - Document results
Description: The entity shall document the results of the risk evaluation and share with national and sector authorities, as required.

Name: Information security risk treatment options - Consider treatment options
Description: The entity shall consider the following risk treatment options and select one or more of them for each of the risks that have been assessed: ' Risk Reduction ' Reducing the risk by applying security controls ' Risk Retention ' Accepting the risk based on the entity's risk accepting criteria established on the information management risk policy  ' Risk Avoidance ' Avoiding the activity or condition causing the risk ' Risk Transfer ' Transferring the risk to another party

Name: Information security risk treatment options - Success of chosen option
Description: The entity shall assess the risk treatment chosen to ensure that the selection of risk treatment options is successful by: ' Deciding whether residual risk levels are tolerable ' If not tolerable, generating a new risk treatment ' Assessing the effectiveness of that treatment

Name: Identification of controls - Control consideration
Description: The entity shall consider the controls included in these Standards as a starting point for the control identification.

Name: Identification of controls - Produce SOA
Description: The entity shall ensure that no controls are overlooked by producing the Statement of Applicability.

Name: Identification of controls - Identify additional controls
Description: The entity shall identify controls in addition to the controls suggested in this regulation that are specific to the entity.

Name: Identification of controls - Take into account risk acceptance criteria
Description: The entity shall take account of the criteria for accepting risks as well as legal, regulatory and contractual requirements when making the control selection.

Name: Risk treatment plan - Requirements to be addressed in the plan
Description:
The risk treatment plan shall identify: 

A. Appropriate management actions 

B. Resources required 

C. Responsibilities and priorities for managing information security risks 

D. Target dates for implementation of the identified controls

Name: Risk treatment plan - Plan to be documented
Description: The entity shall document the risk treatment plan.

Name: Statement of applicability - List of controls
Description: The entity shall produce and document a Statement of Applicability that contains the controls that have been identified as necessary.

Name: Statement of applicability - Reasons for identifying these controls
Description: The entity shall produce and document a Statement of Applicability that contains reasons for identification of these controls.

Name: Statement of applicability - Implementation status
Description: The entity shall produce and document a Statement of Applicability that contains their current status of implementation.

Name: Statement of applicability - Justification for exclusion
Description: The entity shall produce and document a Statement of Applicability that contains justification for exclusion of any of the 'risk-based applicable' controls contained in this regulation.

Name: Information security objectives - SMART Objectives
Description:
The information security objectives shall:     

A. Be consistent with the information security policy      

B. Be measurable (if practicable)      

C. Take into account applicable information security requirements, and risk assessment and treatment results      

D. Be communicated within the entity      

E. Be updated as appropriate      

F. Be documented.

Name: Information security risk assessment review and update - Changes to be accounted
Description:
The entity's monitoring and review processes shall encompass all aspects of the risk management process and shall take account of changes in:      

A. The entity itself      

B. Technology used      

C. Business objectives and processes      

D. Risk criteria and the risk assessment process      

E. Assets and consequences of losses of confidentiality, integrity or availability      

F. Identified threats;      

G. Identified vulnerabilities      

H. Effectiveness of the implemented controls     

I. External events, such as changes to the legal or regulatory environment, changed contractual obligations, and changes in social climate.

Name: Information security risk assessment review and update - Incidents that trigger risk assessment
Description: The entity shall monitor security incidents that might trigger the risk assessment process.

Name: Information security risk assessment review and update - Responsibilities for monitoring and review
Description: Responsibilities for monitoring and review shall be clearly defined and documented.

Name: Risk communication and consultation - Risk communication plan
Description: The entity shall establish a risk communication plan for communicating risk information with key stakeholders including decision-makers within the entity during all stages of the risk management process.

Name: Risk communication and consultation - Consider UAE IA issuances
Description: The entity shall Take into account all UAE IA's issuances with regard to risk management.

Name: Awareness and training policy - Appropriateness
Description: The awareness and training policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Awareness and training policy - Framework for objectives
Description: The awareness and training policy shall provide the framework for setting awareness and training objectives.

Name: Awareness and training policy - Facilitate implementation of controls
Description: The awareness and training policy shall facilitate the implementation of the associated controls.

Name: Awareness and training policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The awareness and training policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities of providers and recipients of awareness and training activities.

Name: Awareness and training program - Effectiveness contribution
Description: The awareness and training program shall inform persons doing work under the entity of their contribution to the effectiveness of information security and the implications of not conforming to the information security requirements.

Name: Awareness and training program - Necessary competencies
Description: The entity shall determine the necessary competencies for personnel performing work effecting information security.

Name: Awareness and training program - Training provision
Description: The entity shall provide training or taking other actions (e.g. employing competent personnel) to satisfy these needs.

Name: Awareness and training program - Effectiveness evaluation
Description: The entity shall evaluate the effectiveness of the actions taken.

Name: Awareness and training program - Maintain records
Description: The entity shall maintain records of education, training, skills, experience and qualifications.

Name: Training needs - Identify needed skills
Description: The entity shall identify the information security skills needed within the entity.

Name: Training needs - Assess current skills
Description: The entity shall assess the current information security skills in place within the entity.

Name: Training needs - Identify gaps
Description: The entity shall identify gaps between required and in place information security skills.

Name: Implementation plan - Training solutions
Description: The entity shall identify solutions for each information security training need that has been identified.

Name: Implementation plan - Timeline for delivery
Description: The entity shall develop a timeline for delivering the information security training solutions.

Name: Implementation plan - Resources
Description: The entity shall ensure resources needed to execute information security training are allocated to the program.

Name: Training execution - Implementation plan
Description: The entity shall ensure that information security training proceeds according to the implementation plan.

Name: Training execution - Training solutions
Description: The entity shall identify alternative information security training solutions if problems with the implementation plan arise.

Name: Training execution - Training needs
Description: The entity shall ensure the updated implementation plan satisfies all of the information security training needs identified.

Name: Training results - Knowledge and skills
Description: The entity shall measure the level of information security knowledge and skills in the entity before and after the training plan is implemented.

Name: Training results - Training solutions
Description: The entity shall ensure that the information security training solutions implemented are meeting the expected outcomes against the knowledge requirements of the entity.

Name: Training results - Corrective action
Description: The entity shall take corrective action to improve or replace training solutions that are not reaching the expected outcome.

Name: Records documentation - Training record
Description: The entity shall ensure that each target for information security training has a documented training record.

Name: Records documentation - Capture activities
Description: The entity shall ensure that all training activities are captured in the individual training records containing personnel education, training, skills, experience and qualifications.

Name: Records documentation - Review records
Description: The entity shall review training records periodically to ensure all stakeholders have completed the necessary training.

Name: Awareness campaign - Define scope
Description: The entity shall define the scope of the awareness campaign in terms of targets and content based on security risks relevant to users' activities.

Name: Awareness campaign - Provide timeline
Description: The entity shall provide a timeline for deploying specific awareness campaigns to meet the program objectives.

Name: Awareness campaign - Comply with timeline
Description: The entity shall ensure that information security campaigns proceed according to the defined program timeline.

Name: Awareness campaign - Alternative campaigns
Description: The entity shall identify alternative information security awareness campaigns if problems with the program timeline arise.

Name: Awareness campaign - Updated campaign
Description: The entity shall ensure the updated information security awareness campaign satisfies all of the program objectives and needs identified.

Name: Human resources security policy - Establish policy
Description: The entity shall establish and maintain a human resources security policy that outlines roles and responsibilities of different stakeholders, and procedures to facilitate the implementation of the associated controls.

Name: Human resources security policy - Implement controls
Description: The entity shall identify and implement associated controls.

Name: Screening - Define background verification
Description: The entity shall define a background verification check process in accordance with relevant laws, regulations and ethics, and proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed, and the perceived risks.

Name: Screening - Perform background verification
Description: The entity shall perform background verification checks for all candidates for employment, contractors and third party personnel.

Name: Terms and conditions of employment - Terms and conditions
Description: The entity shall define standard information security terms and conditions for employees, third parties and contractors.

Name: Terms and conditions of employment - Contract terms
Description: The entity shall include information security terms and conditions in any contract.

Name: Terms and conditions of employment - Understand terms
Description: The entity shall ensure that their employees, contractors, and third parties fully understand their relevant terms and conditions.

Name: Terms and conditions of employment - Review contract
Description: The entity shall review and eventually amend any existing contract with employees, contractors and third parties.

Name: Management responsibilities - Compliance with policies
Description: The entity shall include in human resources security policy that employees, contractors and third party users have to comply with entity security policies and procedures.

Name: Management responsibilities - Inform personnel
Description: The entity shall inform all employees, contractors and third parties of the security policies they are required to be compliant with.

Name: Management responsibilities - Read and accept
Description: The entity shall present, on first access, relevant security policy/guidelines for users to read and accept.

Name: Disciplinary Process - Define process
Description: The entity shall define a formal disciplinary process.

Name: Disciplinary Process - Awareness
Description: The entity shall ensure sufficient awareness about this disciplinary process within the entity.

Name: Disciplinary Process - Enforce
Description: The entity shall enforce the disciplinary process.

Name: Disciplinary Process - Records of breaches
Description: The entity shall keep records of the committed security breaches.

Name: Termination responsibilities - Define policy
Description: The entity shall define an employee termination policy that emphasizes the communication of termination responsibilities in relation to entities information security (including confidentiality and property rights).

Name: Termination responsibilities - Assign responsibility
Description: The entity shall assign responsibility for performing termination or change of employment.

Name: Return of assets - Return of assets
Description: The entity shall include in employee termination policy that all employees, contractors and third parties should return of all assets upon termination of employment, contract or agreement.

Name: Removable of access rights - Verify compliance
Description: The entity shall verify that the termination policy and procedure is followed for any termination or change of employment, contract or agreement with particular attention to revocation of credentials/access to any information facility.

Name: Compliance policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The compliance policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Compliance policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The compliance policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities for establishing compliance requirements.

Name: Compliance policy - Establish requirements
Description: The compliance policy shall outline the approach for establishing compliance requirements.

Name: Compliance policy
Description: The compliance policy shall outline the approach the entity will follow to ensure compliance with the identified requirements at the entity, sector, and national levels.

Name: Identification of applicable legislation - Develop process
Description: The entity shall develop a process to identify on an ongoing basis all compliance requirements applicable to the entity.

Name: Identification of applicable legislation - Determine system requirements
Description: The entity shall determine specific system requirements resulting from the identified compliance requirements.

Name: Identification of applicable legislation - Meet requirements
Description: The entity shall define specific controls to ensure all compliance requirements are met.

Name: Identification of applicable legislation - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review compliance requirements and associated controls for completeness.

Name: Identification of applicable legislation - Legislation requirements
Description: The entity shall document all legislation requirements with individual responsibilities to meet these requirements as well as controls in-place.

Name: Intellectual property rights (IPR) - Develop policy
Description: The entity shall develop and maintain an intellectual property rights compliance policy.

Name: Intellectual property rights (IPR) - Develop process
Description: The entity shall develop a process to identify all applicable requirements the entity must meet in terms of protecting intellectual property rights.

Name: Intellectual property rights (IPR) - Specific requirements
Description: The entity shall  determine specific system requirements resulting from the identified requirements.

Name: Intellectual property rights (IPR) - Meet requirements
Description: The entity shall define specific controls to ensure all intellectual property right protection requirements are met.

Name: Intellectual property rights (IPR) - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review requirements and associated controls for completeness.

Name: Protection of organizational records - Define process
Description: The entity shall define a process for identifying records with specific compliance requirements regarding loss, destruction, falsification, or other applicable characteristics.

Name: Protection of organizational records - Determine requirements
Description: The entity shall determine specific system requirements resulting from the identified requirements.

Name: Protection of organizational records - Define controls
Description: The entity shall define specific controls to ensure all record protection requirements are met.

Name: Protection of organizational records - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review requirements and associated controls for completeness.

Name: Data protection and privacy of personal information - Define process
Description: The entity shall define a process for identifying data with specific compliance requirements regarding protection and privacy.

Name: Data protection and privacy of personal information  - Determine requirements
Description: The entity shall determine specific system requirements resulting from the identified requirements.

Name: Data protection and privacy of personal information - Define controls
Description: The entity shall define specific controls to ensure all data protection and privacy requirements are met.

Name: Data protection and privacy of personal information  - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review requirements and associated controls for completeness.

Name: Prevention of misuse of information systems - Communication
Description: The entity shall clearly communicate to all stakeholders what is considered to be authorized use of information systems.

Name: Prevention of misuse of information systems - Develop capability
Description: The entity shall develop the capability to monitor information systems for unauthorized use.

Name: Prevention of misuse of information systems - Corrective action
Description: The entity shall take corrective action to stop unauthorized use of information systems when detected.

Name: Regulation of cryptographic controls - Define process
Description: The entity shall define a process for identifying applicable compliance requirements regarding use of cryptographic controls within the entity.

Name: Regulation of cryptographic controls - Determine requirements
Description: The entity shall determine specific system requirements resulting from the identified requirements.

Name: Regulation of cryptographic controls - Define controls
Description: The entity shall define specific controls to ensure all cryptographic control requirements are met.

Name: Regulation of cryptographic controls - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review requirements and associated controls for completeness.

Name: Liability to the information sharing community - Liability issues
Description: The entity shall identify any liability issues and remediation requirements regarding unauthorized disclosure of information in all information sharing communities in which the entity participates.

Name: Liability to the information sharing community - Remediation procedures
Description: The entity shall define specific remediation procedures for each relevant information sharing community.

Name: Liability to the information sharing community - Communication
Description: The entity shall communicate to the relevant information sharing community any issues identified regarding remediation procedures.

Name: Compliance with security policies and standards - Identify procedures
Description: Managers shall identify all security procedures that fall within their area of responsibility.

Name: Compliance with security policies and standards - Develop capability
Description: Managers shall develop the capability to monitor the execution of identified security procedures.

Name: Compliance with security policies and standards - Corrective action
Description: Managers shall take corrective action when issues regarding the execution of security procedures are identified.

Name: Technical compliance checking - Define process
Description: The entity shall define and execute a process for routinely checking for technical compliance with security standards.

Name: Technical compliance checking - Results of compliance checking
Description: The entity shall ensure results of compliance checking is performed by, and the results are reviewed by, authorized personnel with adequate technical capabilities.

Name: Technical compliance checking - Report issues
Description: The entity shall report any issues detected during technical compliance checking to the appropriate authority for remediation.

Name: Information systems audit controls - Assign responsibilities
Description: The entity shall assign responsibilities for internal audits of information system controls to an appropriate authority.

Name: Information systems audit controls - Define audit requirements
Description: The entity shall define audit requirements for information system controls.

Name: Information systems audit controls - Audit plan
Description: The entity shall outline an audit plan to meet audit requirements for information system controls.

Name: Information systems audit controls
Description: The entity shall highlight measures taken to ensure audit activities minimize the risk of disruptions to business processes.

Name: Protection of information systems audit tools - Identify audit tools
Description: The entity shall identify all information systems audit tools.

Name: Protection of information systems audit tools - Identify types and classification levels
Description: The entity shall identify the types and classification levels of information stored in information systems audit tools.

Name: Protection of information systems audit tools - Minimum requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum security requirements for information systems audit tools commensurate to the classification levels of the information held.

Name: Audit of community functions - Audit rights
Description: The entity shall identify the audit rights of any information sharing communities to which it is connected.

Name: Audit of community functions - Provisions for external members
Description: The entity shall ensure that provisions for external members are accounted for in the entity's information systems audit plan and tools.

Name: Audit of community functions - Provisions for entity
Description: The entity shall ensure that provisions for the entity to exercise its audit rights are accounted for in the entity's information systems audit plan and tools.

Name: Performance evaluation policy - Overall framework
Description: The entity shall develop and implement a performance evaluation policy that determines the overall framework for performance evaluation.

Name: Performance evaluation policy - Methods of reporting
Description: The entity shall develop and implement a performance evaluation policy that determines the methods of reporting the performance evaluation results to management.

Name: Performance evaluation policy - Integration with measurements
Description: The entity shall develop and implement a performance evaluation policy that determines how to integrate the detailed performance measurements for controls with higher level performance measurements for information security objectives, risk management, etc.

Name: Performance evaluation policy - Integration with incidents
Description: The entity shall develop and implement a performance evaluation policy that determines how to integrate incident reports in the overall picture of performance monitoring.

Name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis, and evaluation - Scope
Description:
The entity shall determine:      

A. What needs to be monitored and measured, including information security processes and controls      

B. The methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation, as applicable, to ensure valid results      

C. When the monitoring and measuring shall be performed      

D. Who shall monitor and measure      

E. When the results from monitoring and measurement shall be analyzed and evaluated      

F. Who shall analyze and evaluate these results.

Name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis, and evaluation - Methods and results
Description: The entity shall document the monitoring and measurement methods and results.

Name: Internal audits - Audit criteria, scope and plan
Description: The entity shall define the audit criteria, scope and audit plan for each audit.

Name: Internal audits - Auditors
Description: The entity shall select auditors and conduct audits to ensure objectivity and the impartiality of the audit process.

Name: Internal audits - Audit results
Description: The entity shall ensure that the results of the audits are reported to relevant management.

Name: Internal audits - Audit program
Description: The entity shall document the audit program and the audit results.

Name: Internal audits - Effective implementation
Description: The entity shall ensure that the internal audit is effectively implemented and maintained.

Name: Internal audits - Management
Description: The internal audits shall be planned, established, implemented and maintained, including the frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting of the internal audits.

Name: Internal audits - Results
Description: The internal audits shall take account of the importance of the processes concerned and the results of previous audits.

Name: Internal audits - Conformance
Description:
The internal audits shall ensure that entity's information security conforms to:      

A. The entity's own requirements for information security      

B. The requirements of this Standard      

C. Any applicable requirements from the entity's sector, national or regulatory environment.

Name: Corrective action - Evaluation
Description:
The entity shall evaluate the need for action to eliminate the causes of nonconformities, in order that it does not recur or occur elsewhere, by:      

A. Reviewing the nonconformity      

B. Determining the causes of the nonconformity      

C. Determining if similar nonconformities exist, or could potentially occur.

Name: Corrective action - Appropriate action needed
Description: The entity shall implement the appropriate action needed to the effects of the encountered nonconformities.

Name: Corrective action - Review effectiveness
Description: The entity shall review the effectiveness of any corrective action taken.

Name: Corrective action - Document actions
Description: The entity shall document the corrective actions taken against the nonconformities.

Name: Continual improvement - Improvement of controls
Description: The entity shall improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of information security controls in place.

Name: Continual improvement - Consider results
Description: The entity shall take account of the performance measurement results and incidents when identifying improvements.

Name: Asset management policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The asset management policy shall be appropriate to the complexity of the entity and to the assets managed by the entity.

Name: Asset management policy -  Management commitment
Description: The asset management policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Asset management policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The asset management policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities.

Name: Asset management policy - Framework
Description: The asset management policy shall provide the framework for managing the entity's assets, including assignment of owners.

Name: Asset management policy - BYOD
Description: The asset management policy shall provide the framework for managing Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) arrangements.

Name: Asset management policy - Document and communicate
Description: The asset management policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Asset management policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The asset management policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Asset management policy
Description: The asset management policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Inventory of assets - Identify
Description: The entity shall identify an inventory of information assets within the entity.

Name: Inventory of assets - Maintain
Description: The entity shall maintain an up-to-date list of assets.

Name: Inventory of assets - Accuracy and consistency
Description: The entity shall ensure accuracy and consistency with other inventories.

Name: Ownership of assets - Establish process
Description: The entity shall establish the process for the assignment of asset ownership and its periodical review.

Name: Ownership of assets - Assign owner
Description: The entity shall assign an owner with management responsibility for each identified asset.

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Establish rules
Description: The entity shall establish and document the rules for the acceptable use of assets.

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Adapt rules
Description: The entity shall adapt rules to the different roles (management, users, administrators, operators, contractors, etc.).

Name: Acceptable use of assets - Circulation and acceptance
Description: The entity shall ensure circulation and acceptance of the rules by employees, contractors and third parties.

Name: Acceptable use of assets
Description: The entity shall ensure compliance with the established rules.

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Establish rules
Description: The entity shall establish the rules for the acceptable use of personal assets that are used on the entity's environment.

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Adapt rules
Description: The entity shall adapt rules to the different roles (management, users, administrators, operators, contractors, etc.).

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Circulation and acceptance
Description: The entity shall ensure circulation and acceptance of the rules by employees, contractors and third parties.

Name: Acceptable bring your own device (BYOD) arrangements - Compliance level
Description: The entity shall measure compliance with these rules.

Name: Classification of information - Classification scheme
Description: The classification shall include an information classification scheme based on information value, legal requirements, sensitivity, and criticality to the entity.

Name: Classification of information - Degree of protection
Description: The classification shall include the degree of protection required for each category.

Name: Classification of information - Accountable owners mapping
Description: The information classification scheme shall ensure information classification based on the established levels and mapped to accountable owners.

Name: Classification of information - Updated information
Description: The information classification scheme shall ensure an up-to-date information classification in accordance with changes of their value, sensitivity and criticality through their life-cycle.

Name: Classification of information - Automated systems
Description: The information classification scheme shall ensure the possibility to be accessed by automated systems to enforce specific protections based on the classification level.

Name: Classification of information - Physical assets
Description: The information classification scheme shall ensure sufficient information regarding physical assets (locations, data centres, networks, systems, storage, etc.) used to store, process or transmit information assets is provided.

Name: Labeling of information - Establish procedure
Description: The entity shall establish a procedure for labeling of information and its related assets in physical or electronic formats to reflect their attributed classification.

Name: Labeling of information - Apply label
Description: The entity shall apply the appropriate label on information.

Name: Handling of information assets - Develop procedures
Description: The entity shall develop handling procedures for processing, storing and communicating information consistent with its classification and its attached label.

Name: Handling of information assets - Safeguard information
Description: The entity shall safeguard the information in accordance with the established procedures.

Name: Management of removable media - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish media management procedures along its lifecycle (setup, distribution, utilization and disposal).

Name: Management of removable media - Identify protection levels
Description: The entity shall identify the needed protection levels in accordance with the classification scheme.

Name: Management of removable media - Inhibit use of media
Description: The entity shall inhibit the use of removable media in those information systems that do not require it.

Name: Management of removable media - Control users
Description: The entity shall control users of removable media.

Name: Disposal of media - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish procedures for secure disposal of media containing confidential information based on the sensitivity of that information.

Name: Disposal of media - Destroy media
Description: The entity shall destroy media, both paper and digital, when no longer serving the entity.

Name: Disposal of media - Records of disposal
Description: The entity shall keep records for disposed media (containing or used to contain confidential information) when no longer needed.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Management commitment
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities for the physical and environmental security.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Physical location
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall consider the Information Assets classification and their physical location (storage, processing, transfer).

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Communication
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Physical and environmental security policy - Management
Description: The physical and environmental security policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Physical security perimeter - Security areas
Description: The entity shall identify and classify security areas based on the assets and information they process or contain.

Name: Physical security perimeter - Security perimeters
Description: The entity shall define security perimeters for every classified security level to ensure the right level of protection is applied.

Name: Physical security perimeter - Security countermeasures
Description: The entity shall ensure the right security countermeasures are adopted to protect areas that contain information and information systems.

Name: Physical entry controls - Authenticate
Description: The entity shall authenticate all persons accessing secure areas.

Name: Physical entry controls - Document access
Description: The entity shall document the access to secure areas.

Name: Physical entry controls - Visible ID card
Description: The entity shall ensure that all persons wear some form of visible identification within the entity's premises.

Name: Physical entry controls - Access logs
Description: The entity shall update and monitor access logs.

Name: Physical entry controls - Escort requirements
Description: The entity shall in case of contractors/third parties, they shall be always escorted, unless the area is explicitly designated for them with no escort requirement.

Name: Securing offices, rooms, and facilities - Establish rules
Description: The entity shall establish rules to avoid access by the public to key facilities in line with the physical and environmental policy.

Name: Securing offices, rooms, and facilities - Avoid obvious signs
Description: The entity shall avoid obvious signs that indicates the type of information or activities in the secure areas.

Name: Protecting against external and environmental threats - Establish policies
Description: The entity shall establish policies and procedures for the storage of hazardous or combustible materials to reduce their risks on secure areas in line with the physical and environmental policy.

Name: Protecting against external and environmental threats - Fallback equipment
Description: The entity shall secure fallback equipment and backup media from damage caused by a natural or man-made disaster.

Name: Protecting against external and environmental threats
Description: The entity shall ensure that all physical protection countermeasures and procedures are aligned and coherent to Risk Assessment.

Name: Working in secure areas - Guidelines
Description: The entity shall establish guidelines for working in secure areas.

Name: Working in secure areas - Accept rules
Description: The entity shall make sure all personnel accessing secure areas is aware and accepts rules and guidelines.

Name: Working in secure areas - Supervise activities
Description: The entity shall supervise activities in secure areas.

Name: Working in secure areas - Access of devices
Description: The entity shall control access of devices to secure areas.

Name: Public access, delivery, and loading areas - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish access procedures to loading and unloading areas to restrict access to only authorized personnel.

Name: Public access, delivery, and loading areas - Physically segregate
Description: The entity shall physically segregate loading and unloading activities.

Name: Public access, delivery, and loading areas - Incoming and outgoing material
Description: The entity shall inspect and register incoming and outgoing material in accordance with the entity's asset management procedures.

Name: Equipment siting and protection - Establish guidelines
Description: The entity shall establish guidelines for the physical protection of equipment against unauthorized access.

Name: Equipment siting and protection - Monitor
Description: The entity shall monitor the environmental conditions and alert in case of a potential threat.

Name: Supporting utilities - Test
Description: Supporting utilities shall be tested for any malfunctioning.

Name: Supporting utilities - Protection
Description: Supporting utilities shall ensure protection and uninterrupted power supply on information systems.

Name: Supporting utilities - Power failure
Description: Supporting utilities shall provide emergency lighting in case of main power failure.

Name: Supporting utilities - Maintenance logs
Description: Supporting utilities shall have up-to-date utilities maintenance logs.

Name: Cabling security - Physical tampering
Description: The entity shall protect power and telecommunication cables against physical tempering.

Name: Cabling security - Segregate cables
Description: The entity shall segregated power and telecommunication cables to prevent interference.

Name: Cabling security - Network scan
Description: The entity shall scan the network on a regular basis to identify unauthorized devices connected to the network.

Name: Equipment maintenance - Supplier recommendations
Description: The entity shall document suppliers recommendations for the maintenance of equipment and make them available to maintenance personnel.

Name: Equipment maintenance - Establish policies
Description: The entity shall establish policies and procedures for decommissioning and commissioning of equipment to ensure protection of sensitive data.

Name: Equipment maintenance - Maintenance logs
Description: The entity shall keep a maintenance logs for all equipment.

Name: Security of equipment off-premises
Description: The entity shall establish policies to protect off-site equipment in line with the physical and environmental policy.

Name: Secure disposal of reuse of equipment - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish procedures for secure disposal or re-use of equipment based on the sensitivity of stored information.

Name: Secure disposal of reuse of equipment - Record
Description: The entity shall keep record of disposed equipment when no longer needed.

Name: Removal of property - Authorization procedure
Description: The entity shall establish an authorization procedure for taking information assets off-site.

Name: Removal of property - List of assets
Description: The entity shall maintain the list of information assets off-site with the authorized employees, contractors and third party users.

Name: Unattended user equipment - User responsibilities
Description: The entity shall establish user responsibilities and procedures when leaving equipment unattended.

Name: Unattended user equipment - Configure equipment
Description: The entity shall configure equipment and systems to implement automatic protections when left unattended.

Name: Clear desk and clear screen policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The clear desk and clear screen policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Clear desk and clear screen policy - Responsibilities
Description: The clear desk and clear screen policy shall outline the responsibilities of the users with respect to clear desk and clear screen.

Name: Clear desk and clear screen policy - Formalized
Description: The clear desk and clear screen policy shall be formalized and readily available to all users.

Name: Clear desk and clear screen policy - Print
Description: The clear desk and clear screen policy shall be printed and made available to all desks subject to clear desk policy.

Name: Operations management policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The Operations Management Policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Operations management policy - Framework
Description: The Operations Management Policy shall provide the framework for managing the operations of systems, processes, and controls related to information security.

Name: Common systems configuration guidelines - Identify products
Description: The guidelines shall identify common information technology products used within the entity.

Name: Common systems configuration guidelines - Minimum configurations
Description: The guidelines shall define minimum security configurations to be employed in each product.

Name: Documented operating procedures - Document operating procedures
Description: The entity shall document operating procedures in a format that facilitates dissemination to all relevant stakeholders.

Name: Documented operating procedures - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall ensure operating procedures are reviewed periodically.

Name: Documented operating procedures - Aware
Description: The entity shall ensure all relevant stakeholders are aware of and have access to relevant operating procedures.

Name: Change management - Document process
Description: The entity shall document a change management process.

Name: Change management - Integrate controls
Description: The entity shall integrate specific process controls to ensure the change management process is executed correctly.

Name: Change management - Define the systems
Description: The entity shall define the systems to which the change management process applies.

Name: Change management - Assign responsibilities
Description: The entity shall assign management responsibilities for control of changes to identified systems.

Name: Segregation of duties - Identify specific sets
Description: The entity shall identify specific sets of duties that should be segregated.

Name: Segregation of duties - Assign segregation requirements
Description: The entity shall ensure duties with segregation requirements are assigned to different resources.

Name: Segregation of duties - Implement alternative controls
Description: The entity shall implement suitable alternative controls in the case that duties with segregation requirements cannot be assigned to different resources.

Name: Separation of development, test, and operational facilities - Identify level of separation
Description: The entity shall identify the appropriate level of separation between operational, test, and development environments.

Name: Separation of development, test, and operational facilities - Transferring software
Description: The entity shall define the rules for transferring software and systems from one environment to another.

Name: Separation of development, test, and operational facilities - Integrate rules
Description: The entity shall ensure the rules are integrated into the system / software development lifecycle.

Name: Capacity management - Measure capacity
Description: The entity shall have the ability to measure capacity of current systems and estimate capacity requirements of planned systems.

Name: Capacity management - Integrate with relevant controls
Description: The entity shall integrate capacity management controls into relevant demand management and software / system development lifecycle processes.

Name: Capacity management - Adjustments
Description: The entity shall make necessary adjustments to capacity to maintain required system performance.

Name: System acceptance and testing - Define requirements
Description: The entity shall define the requirements for testing new / updated systems prior to placing them in the operational environment.

Name: System acceptance and testing - Acceptable parameters
Description: The entity shall define the acceptable parameters for each requirement.

Name: System acceptance and testing - Test
Description: The entity shall ensure tests are carried out and that results are documented.

Name: System acceptance and testing - Assign responsibility
Description: The entity shall formally assign responsibility for ensuring tests are completed prior to accepting new systems into operational environment.

Name: Controls against malware - Anti-malware protection
Description: The entity shall employ anti-malware protection mechanisms for the network as well as servers, workstations, laptops and other devices connected to it.

Name: Controls against malware - Updated anti-malware
Description: The entity shall ensure that all anti-malware protection are up-to-date.

Name: Controls against malware - Scan systems
Description: The entity shall periodically scan all information systems files as well as files downloaded from public networks.

Name: Controls against malware - Scan email attachments
Description: The entity shall scan all email attachments before reaching user's inbox.

Name: Controls against malware - Scan media
Description: The entity shall scan removable media for malware every time they are connected to the information systems.

Name: Controls against malware - Configure systems
Description: The entity shall configure servers, workstations, laptops so that they don't 'auto-run' contents from removable media.

Name: Controls against malware - Monitor tools
Description: The entity shall monitor anti-malware protection tools for malware detection events that should be logged and a notification should be sent to the administrators.

Name: Controls against malware - User awareness
Description: The entity shall ensure that users are aware of malware risks, behaviors and preventative actions.

Name: Information Backup - Establish guidelines
Description: The entity shall establish guidelines for determining what information and software requires backup and how often.

Name: Information Backup - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish and document clear backup procedures and system capabilities for all applicable backup requirements.

Name: Information Backup - Test
Description: The entity shall ensure backed up information and software is routinely tested for reliability.

Name: Information Backup - IT staff skills
Description: The entity shall ensure IT staff have the skills and qualification to conduct the backup procedures.

Name: Monitoring policy and procedures - Outline
Description: The monitoring policy and related procedures shall outline what system aspects shall be monitored, how they shall be monitored, and how often they shall be monitored.

Name: Monitoring policy and procedures - Assign responsibilities
Description: The monitoring policy and related procedures shall assign responsibility for monitoring activities.

Name: Monitoring policy and procedures - Incident response process
Description: The monitoring policy and related procedures shall define how information from monitoring activities will be fed into the incident response process.

Name: Monitoring policy and procedures - Account for requirements
Description: The monitoring policy and related procedures shall account for any sector or national requirements regarding information to be shared with external entities.

Name: Monitoring policy and procedures - Document policy and procedures
Description: The monitoring policy and related procedures shall be documented.

Name: Audit logging - Identify all activities
Description: The entity shall identify all activities to be captured in audit logs for all hardware devices, operating systems and installed applications.

Name: Audit logging - Minimum information requirements
Description: The entity shall identify minimum information requirements for each activity to be captured.

Name: Audit logging - Minimum frequency requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum frequency requirements for reviewing audit logs.

Name: Audit logging - Review audit logs
Description: The entity shall ensure audit logs are reviewed by personnel with appropriate training and skills.

Name: Audit logging - Minimum time requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum time requirements for maintaining audit logs.

Name: Monitoring system use - Identify systems
Description: The entity shall identify all types of system use to be monitored.

Name: Monitoring system use - Minimum requirements
Description: The entity shall identify minimum information gathering requirements for each monitoring activity.

Name: Monitoring system use - Define frequency requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum frequency requirements for reviewing information gathered from monitoring activities.

Name: Monitoring system use - Training and skills
Description: The entity shall ensure information gathered from monitoring activities is reviewed by personnel with appropriate training and skills.

Name: Monitoring system use - Define time requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum time requirements for maintaining information gathered from monitoring activities.

Name: Protection of log information - Identify log information
Description: The entity shall identify the log information across all information systems that shall be protected.

Name: Protection of log information - Protect log information
Description: The entity shall ensure log information are protected commensurate to the sensitivity of the content of the logs.

Name: Administrator and operator logs - Identify activities
Description: The entity shall identify all activities to be captured in administrator and operator logs.

Name: Administrator and operator logs - Identify requirements
Description: The entity shall identify minimum information requirement's for each activity to be captured.

Name: Administrator and operator logs - Define frequency requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum frequency requirements for reviewing administrator and operator logs.

Name: Administrator and operator logs - Training and skills
Description: The entity shall ensure administrator and operator logs are reviewed by personnel with appropriate training and skills.

Name: Administrator and operator logs - Define time requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum time requirements for maintaining administrator and operator logs

Name: Fault logging - Identify faults
Description: The entity shall identify all faults to be captured in fault logs.

Name: Fault logging - Minimum requirements
Description: The entity shall identify minimum information requirements for each fault to be captured.

Name: Fault logging - Minimum frequency requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum frequency requirements for reviewing fault logs.

Name: Fault logging - Training and skills
Description: The entity shall ensure fault logs are reviewed and analyzed by personnel with appropriate training and skills.

Name: Fault logging - Minimum time requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum time requirements for maintaining fault logs.

Name: Clock synchronization - Define formats
Description: The entity shall define the date / time format and these Standards time to be used in all systems.

Name: Clock synchronization - Define stratum level of clocks
Description: The entity shall define the stratum level of clocks needed for each type of network element.

Name: Clock synchronization - Regularly check
Description: The entity shall regularly check that the clocks of all relevant information processing systems are synchronized.

Name: Communications policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The communications policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Communications policy - Management commitment
Description: The communications policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Communications policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The communications policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities.

Name: Communications policy - Framework
Description: The communications policy shall provide the framework to protect information in transit from interception, copying, modification, mis-routing, destruction, and other unauthorized activities.

Name: Communications policy - Document and communicate
Description: The communications policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Communications policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The communications policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Communications policy - Management
Description: The communications policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Information transfer procedures - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish information transfer procedures.

Name: Information transfer procedures - Outline conditions
Description: The procedures shall outline conditions under which the transfer of information must be protected.

Name: Information transfer procedures - Identify controls
Description: The procedures shall identify specific controls to be put in place to ensure information is adequately protected during transfer.

Name: Information transfer procedures - Identify actions
Description: The procedures shall identify actions to be taken when issues arise regarding the transfer of information.

Name: Information transfer procedures - Management
Description: The procedures shall be documented, maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Agreements of information transfer - Identify requirements
Description: The entity shall identify all security requirements for exchanging information and software with external parties.

Name: Agreements of information transfer - Establish agreement
Description: The entity shall establish an exchange of information agreement with each external party outlining clear roles and responsibilities of each party.

Name: Agreements of information transfer - Awareness
Description: The entity shall ensure external parties are aware of all information security requirements and policies that are necessary before signing the agreement.

Name: Agreements of information transfer - Monitor the exchange of information
Description: The entity shall monitor the exchange of information and software with external parties to ensure the requirements in the agreement are being met.

Name: Agreements of information transfer - Corrective action
Description: The entity shall take corrective action when the exchange of information or software does not follow the terms of the agreement.

Name: Physical media in transit - Identify
Description: The entity shall identify physical media carrying sensitive information.

Name: Physical media in transit - Labeling requirements
Description: The entity shall define labeling requirements for physical media carrying sensitive information.

Name: Physical media in transit - Tracking
Description: The entity shall ensure physical media in transit carrying sensitive information is tracked sufficiently in accordance with the sensitivity of the information it contains.

Name: Physical media in transit - Loss of media
Description: The entity shall define measures to be taken in the event of loss of physical media in transit carrying sensitive information.

Name: Physical media in transit - Log of transitions
Description: The entity shall keep a log of all transitions.

Name: Electronic messaging - Identify
Description: The entity shall identify all means of electronic messaging in which the entity's information assets can be transmitted.

Name: Electronic messaging - Define rules
Description: The entity shall for each category of electronic messaging identified, define rules regarding the type of information that can be transmitted and specific controls needed.

Name: Electronic messaging - Capability to monitor
Description: The entity shall develop the capability to monitor electronic messaging to ensure controls are implemented and the rules are followed.

Name: Electronic messaging - Corrective action
Description: The entity shall take corrective action when information is transmitted through electronic messaging in a manner inconsistent with the established rules.

Name: Business information systems - Interconnections
Description: The policies and procedures shall identify all points of interconnection between business information systems.

Name: Business information systems - Types of information
Description: The policies and procedures shall identify the types of information to be protected regarding the identified interconnections.

Name: Business information systems - Identify security measures
Description: The policies and procedures shall identify appropriate security measures to be taken to protect each type of information.

Name: Business information systems - Management
Description: The policies and procedures shall be documented, maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Electronic commerce - Identify all instances
