Description: The entity shall identify all instances of electronic commerce within the entity that require passing information over public networks.

Name: Electronic commerce - Risk assessment
Description: The entity shall identify appropriate security measures for information passing over public networks based on the risk assessment.

Name: Electronic commerce - Service agreements
Description: The entity shall ensure security requirements are captured in service agreements with e-commerce partners.

Name: Electronic commerce - Monitor activities
Description: The entity shall monitor e-commerce activities for on-going compliance with security requirements.

Name: Online transactions - Identify all information
Description: The entity shall identify all information used in on-line transactions.

Name: Online transactions - Identify security measures
Description: The entity shall identify appropriate security measures for information used in on-line transactions based on the risk assessment.

Name: Online transactions - Service agreements
Description: The entity shall ensure security requirements are captured in service agreements with all partners involved in on-line transactions.

Name: Online transactions - Monitor
Description: The entity shall monitor on-line transactions for on-going compliance with security requirements.

Name: Publicly available information - Identify all information
Description: The entity shall identify all information to be made available on a publicly available system.

Name: Publicly available information - Define security requirements
Description: The entity shall define security requirements for information to be made available on a publicly available system based on the risk assessment.

Name: Publicly available information - Monitor information
Description: The entity shall monitor information being made available on publicly available systems for unauthorized modification.

Name: Publicly available information - Public information
Description: The entity shall ensure that all public information is sanitized and approved.

Name: Connectivity to information sharing platforms - Identify platforms
Description: The entity shall identify all relevant information sharing platforms to which the entity will connect.

Name: Connectivity to information sharing platforms - Determine security requirements
Description: The entity shall determine the security requirements for connecting to identified platforms.

Name: Connectivity to information sharing platforms - Identify controls
Description: The entity shall identify specific controls needed to meet the security requirements for each information sharing platform.

Name: Connectivity to information sharing platforms - Develop capabilities
Description: The entity shall develop the capabilities needed for secure connectivity to any required sector, national, or international information sharing communities.

Name: Information released into information sharing communities - Release
Description: For each connected information sharing platform, the entity shall identify all information to be released into the information sharing community utilizing the platform.

Name: Information released into information sharing communities - Format, classification and treatment
Description: For each connected information sharing platform, the entity shall implement minimum format, classification, and treatment requirements as outlined by the platform manager.

Name: Information released into information sharing communities - Additional security requirements
Description: For each connected information sharing platform, the entity shall identify and implement any additional security requirements needed to protect the released information in line with the entity's risk assessment.

Name: Information released into information sharing communities - Capabilities
Description: For each connected information sharing platform, the entity shall develop the capabilities needed to share information securely within any required sector, national or international information sharing communities.

Name: Network controls - Interconnectivity
Description: The entity shall identify all network components and interconnectivity between them.

Name: Network controls - Network diagram
Description: The entity shall document and maintain network diagram that includes all network components as well as their connections.

Name: Network controls - Risk assessment
Description: The entity shall perform a risk assessment on individual network components and the network as a whole to identify vulnerabilities requiring action.

Name: Network controls - Mitigate vulnerabilities
Description: The entity shall identify and implement specific network controls needed to mitigate the vulnerabilities identified.

Name: Network controls - Monitor controls
Description: The entity shall continually monitor the in-place controls for efficiency and effectiveness.

Name: Security of network services - Security requirements
Description: The entity shall specify which network services are subject to specific security requirements.

Name: Security of network services - Service requirements
Description: The entity shall define minimum security requirements for each identified service.

Name: Security of network services - Service level agreements
Description: The entity shall ensure minimum security requirements are captured in service level agreements for network services.

Name: Security of network services - Network service requirements
Description: The entity shall ensure minimum security requirements are implemented in network services.

Name: Segregation of networks - Identify criteria
Description: The entity shall identify criteria for grouping information services, users, and information systems into different groups that facilitate segregation on networks.

Name: Segregation of networks - Segregation requirements
Description: The entity shall for each group, identify specific segregation requirements.

Name: Segregation of networks - Service development lifecycle
Description: The entity shall ensure identified segregation requirements are included in the relevant system / service development lifecycle.

Name: Segregation of networks - Periodic evaluation
Description: The entity shall periodically evaluate the effectiveness of implemented segregation strategies and identify areas for improvement.

Name: Security of wireless networks - Site survey
Description: The entity shall undertake and document a site survey to determine the optimal physical locations to avoid stray signal leaking too far outside of the entity's physical perimeter.

Name: Security of wireless networks - Criteria for grouping
Description: The entity shall identify criteria for grouping information services, users, and information systems into different groups that facilitate segregation on wireless networks.

Name: Security of wireless networks - Identify controls
Description: The entity shall for each wireless network, identify the security controls that should be in place based on the required protection level of the information services, users, and information systems it supports.

Name: Security of wireless networks - Evaluate the effectiveness
Description: The entity shall periodically evaluate the effectiveness of implemented segregation strategies and identify areas for improvement.

Name: Access control policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The access control policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Access control policy - Management commitment
Description: The access control policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Access control policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The access control policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities for granting and denying access.

Name: Access control policy - User owned devices
Description: The access control policy shall provide the framework for the protection of mobile devices against prevailing risks, including users owned devices.

Name: Access control policy - Mobile devices
Description: The access control policy shall provide the framework to protect information from unauthorized access and grant access to the appropriate users and mobile devices.

Name: Access control policy - Communicate
Description: The access control policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Access control policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The access control policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Access control policy - Management
Description: The access control policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: User registration - Establish procedure
Description: The entity shall establish and formalize procedures for the registration and de-registration of users.

Name: User registration - Separate account
Description: The entity shall ensure that a separate account is created for each person requiring access, and prohibit sharing of same accounts across multiple users.

Name: User registration - Revoke access
Description: The entity shall immediately revoke access from users who have changed roles or jobs or left the entity following the established procedure.

Name: User registration - Periodic check
Description: The entity shall periodically check and revoke access related to temporary and inactive accounts.

Name: Privilege management - Record of privileges
Description: The entity shall maintain a record of all allocated privileges.

Name: Privilege management - Local administrative privileges
Description: The entity shall never grant users with domain or local administrative privileges.

Name: Privilege management - Administrative activities
Description: The entity shall ensure that administrator accounts are used only for system administration activities (e.g. no email or web surfing).

Name: Privilege management - Two-factor authentication
Description: The entity shall use two-factor authentication for all administrative access.

Name: Privilege management - Access logs
Description: The entity shall ensure that all administrative access are logged and audited.

Name: User security credentials management - Establish policy
Description: The entity shall establish a user security credential management policy for users and administrators that is appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: User security credentials management - Include process
Description: The entity shall ensure that the policy includes a secure process to provide users with security credentials; policy should also include credential revocation procedure and credential re-allocation.

Name: User security credentials management - Use of credentials
Description: The entity shall in case of use of security credentials (i.e. passwords) change default security credentials of all systems and applications.

Name: User security credentials management - Password hashing
Description: The entity shall in case of credentials, always store them in a well-hashed (including 'salting') or encrypted format.

Name: User security credentials management - Multi-factor authentication
Description: The entity shall for accessing critical resources/assets, implement credential systems based on multi-factor authentication.

Name: Review of user access rights - Access right records
Description: The entity shall maintain access right records for all assets, and identify any granted special access.

Name: Review of user access rights - Access right review procedure
Description: The entity shall establish a access right review procedure to ensure access rights are reviewed periodically or on any changes in users' status.

Name: Review of user access rights - Periodic check
Description: The entity shall periodically check the granted special access to ensure their validity.

Name: Policy on use of network services - Establish policy
Description: The entity shall establish a policy for the use of network services that is appropriate to the entity.

Name: Policy on use of network services - Develop framework
Description: The entity shall develop the framework for managing the network services and ensure the right level of protection provided against unauthorized access.

Name: Policy on use of network services - Limit access
Description: The entity shall limit user access to the required network services and in line with the developed framework.

Name: User authentication for external connections - Remote login
Description: The entity shall require all remote login (users and administrators) to be done over secure channels.

Name: User authentication for external connections - Authentication methods
Description: The entity shall ensure appropriate authentication methods to be used to control access by remote users.

Name: User authentication for external connections - Block access
Description: The entity shall block access to a machine (either remotely or locally) for administrator-level accounts.

Name: Equipment identification in networks - Equipment identification
Description: The entity shall use equipment identification mechanisms to automatically authenticate legitimate connections and detect unauthorized devices connected to the network.

Name: Remote diagnostic and configuration protection - Identify ports
Description: The entity shall identify all ports and services that are used for diagnostic or configuration.

Name: Remote diagnostic and configuration protection - Uninstall services
Description: The entity shall disable or uninstall the diagnostic and configuration services that are not required and define a protection mechanism for the ones that are required.

Name: Remote diagnostic and configuration protection - Enable access mechanisms
Description: The entity shall enable access control mechanisms (including strong authentication) to allow access only to authorized personnel.

Name: Remote diagnostic and configuration protection - Log remote access activities
Description: The entity shall log all remote access activities related to diagnostic and configuration.

Name: Network connection control - Establish procedure
Description: The entity shall establish a procedure to provide access to shared networks in line with Access Control Policy and requirements of the business applications.

Name: Network connection control - Restrict user access
Description: The entity shall restrict users access to the network based on predefined tables and rules (e.g. certain time of the day).

Name: Network routing control - Identify routing equipment
Description: The entity shall Identify all routing equipment (e.g. routers, firewalls, and switches.).

Name: Network routing control - Establish secure configuration
Description: The entity shall establish a secure configuration and rules for network routing.

Name: Network routing control - Address violation
Description: The entity shall enable source and destination address violation against rules checking on the routing equipment.

Name: Network routing control - Routing protection
Description: The entity shall enable routing protection countermeasures to avoid manipulation of routing systems/tables.

Name: Network routing control - Sub-networks
Description: The entity shall implement sub-networks for publicly accessible systems that are separated from internal organizational networks.

Name: Network routing control - Managed interfaces
Description: The entity shall connect to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices (such as firewalls).

Name: Network routing control - Monitor communications
Description: The entity shall monitor communications with external systems and with key internal systems for suspicious traffic.

Name: Wireless access - Establish restrictions and implementation
Description: The entity shall establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access.

Name: Wireless access - Authorize wireless access
Description: The entity shall authorize wireless access to the information system prior to allowing such connections.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Identify systems
Description: The entity shall identify the systems, applications and services that require user authentication.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Classify systems
Description: The entity shall classify the identified systems, application and services based on the level of protection needed.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish the appropriate log-on and log-off procedures to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized access.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Maximum session time
Description: The entity shall set a maximum session time for logged on users for sensitive systems and applications.

Name: Secure log on procedures - Terminate sessions
Description: The entity shall terminate inactive sessions after a predefined period of inactivity.

Name: User identification and authentication - Unique identifier
Description: The entity shall provide a unique identifier to each user.

Name: User identification and authentication - Authentication techniques
Description: The entity shall enable authentication techniques that are suitable to entity.

Name: User identification and authentication - Logging
Description: The entity shall ensure all restricted activity are logged with the associated authenticated users.

Name: User credentials management system - Automate
Description: The user credential management system shall automate the user credential change procedure ensuring the authenticity of the associate user identity.

Name: User credentials management system - Validate
Description: The user credential management system shall validate that the changed credentials have sufficient strength for their intended use to ensure quality secret authentication.

Name: User credentials management system - Maximum lifetime
Description: The user credential management system shall set a maximum lifetime and reuse conditions.

Name: Use of system utilities - Identify utilities
Description: The entity shall identify the system utilities and identify the respective appropriate level of protection.

Name: Use of system utilities - Track of user access rights
Description: The entity shall keep track of the users access rights provided to the system utilities.

Name: Use of system utilities - Restrict usage
Description: The entity shall restrict use of utility programs only to authorized personnel.

Name: Use of system utilities - Monitor usage
Description: The entity shall monitor the use of utility programs.

Name: Information access restriction - Restrict
Description: The entity shall ensure access to information and application system functions is restricted.

Name: Information access restriction - Basis of restriction
Description: The entity shall ensure access restriction is based on user's roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information access restriction - Assign access rights
Description: The entity shall assign the appropriate level of access rights to information and application functions.

Name: Information access restriction - Adjust access control
Description: The entity shall for each user and support personnel, adjust their access control based on specific business needs.

Name: Sensitive system isolation - Identify sensitive applications
Description: The entity shall identify sensitive applications and allocate the appropriate resources to ensure its security.

Name: Publicly accessible content - Develop procedures
Description: The entity shall develop and formalize procedures for the publishing of public information to ensure non-public information is not exposed.

Name: Publicly accessible content - Adopt procedures
Description: The entity shall adopt procedures to periodically verify if sensitive information is exposed to the general public.

Name: Access control for mobile devices - Establish security measures
Description: The entity shall establish security measures for usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for entity-controlled mobile devices in line with the access control policy.

Name: Access control for mobile devices - Authorize connection of mobile devices
Description: The entity shall authorize connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems in accordance with the established security measures.

Name: Teleworking - Establish security measures
Description: The entity shall establish security measures for using teleworking in line with the access control policy.

Name: Teleworking - Authorize the usage of teleworking
Description: The entity shall authorize the usage of teleworking in accordance with the established security measures.

Name: Third-party security policy  - Appropriate policy
Description: The third party security policy shall be appropriate to the relationship of the entity and the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Management commitment
Description: The third party security policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Third-party security policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The third party security policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities for managing third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Framework
Description: The third party security policy shall provide the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives to be used when engaging third parties.

Name: Third-party security policy - Communicate
Description: The third party security policy shall be documented and communicated to the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The third party security policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by the third party.

Name: Third-party security policy - Management
Description: The third party security policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Service delivery - Security requirements
Description: The entity shall ensure that security requirements for third parties are included in the service delivery agreement for each party.

Name: Service delivery - Measurable requirements
Description: The entity shall ensure these security requirements are measurable.

Name: Service delivery - Report on requirements
Description: The entity shall require third parties to measure and report to the entity on these service requirements.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Delivery reports
Description: The entity shall monitor third parties' services and ensure required delivery reports are received.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Qualified personnel
Description: The entity shall ensure reports received from third parties are reviewed by qualified personnel.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Incident and problems
Description: The entity shall ensure that information security incidents and problems identified in the reports are managed properly.

Name: Monitoring and review of third-party services - Audits
Description: The entity shall carry out audits for third parties services at a regular basis.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Service agreements
Description: The entity shall ensure that third party service agreements include a methodology for communicating change management issues between the entity and the third party.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Parameters for changes
Description: The entity shall define the parameters for changes that must be communicated between the entity and the third party.

Name: Managing changes to third-party services - Assess changes
Description: The entity shall assess the changes taking into account the criticality of business systems and processes involved and re-assessment of risks.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Due diligence
Description: The entity shall perform necessary due diligence to determine requirements and restrictions relevant to information processing, storage and retention in the cloud environment.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Cloud environment
Description: The entity shall include the cloud environment (and, where possible, its components) into the risk assessment process.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Governance policies and procedures
Description: The entity shall develop and maintain information governance policies and procedures to ensure compliance with identified requirements and risk mitigation strategies.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Information security incidents
Description: The entity shall ensure information about security incidents that happen at the cloud service provider are communicated.

Name: Information security requirements for cloud environments - Right to audit
Description: The entity shall where possible, reserve a right to audit the security arrangements in place at cloud service provider.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Service delivery agreement
Description: Each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for understanding and maintaining awareness of where information with applicable restrictions will be stored or transmitted in the cloud environment.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Information migration plans
Description: Each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for ensuring appropriate information migration plans at the end of the service period.

Name: Service delivery agreements with cloud providers - Cloud security requirements
Description: Each service delivery agreement for cloud services shall include provisions for ensuring all other cloud security requirements determined relevant by the entity are included in the service delivery agreement.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall be appropriate to the relationship of the entity and all internal and external parties involved in the process.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Management commitment
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall outline the roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Framework
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall provide the framework for setting information security objectives and/or include information security objectives to be used when engaging in the process.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Communicate
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy - Management
Description: The information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance policy shall be maintained, reviewed and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - New information systems or enhancements
Description: The security requirements shall be used for new information systems or enhancements to existing information systems.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Approval
Description: The security requirements shall be approved by the appropriate business manager or equivalent.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Address all requirements
Description: The security requirements shall address all requirements for security controls identified during the risk assessment.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Verify security controls
Description: The security requirements shall outline how to verify that the requirements for security controls have been met.

Name: Security requirements analysis and specification - Security requirements
Description: The security requirements shall be included in the statement of business and technical requirements.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training requirements
Description: The entity shall require the developer to identify training requirements based on implemented security functions and in line with the Awareness and Training Policy for the correct use and operation of the functions.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training programs
Description: The entity shall require the developer to design and execute appropriate training programs to meet these requirements.

Name: Developer-provided training - Training provisions
Description: The entity shall require the developer to include training provisions in the relevant service delivery agreement.

Name: Input data validation - Guidelines or parameters
Description: The entity shall define a set of guidelines or parameters to be used to validate data input into applications.

Name: Input data validation - Set of values
Description: The entity shall define a set of values for each guideline or parameter to identify acceptable and unacceptable values.

Name: Input data validation - Validation
Description: The entity shall provide guidance on how to validate each guideline or parameter.

Name: Control of internal processing - Guidelines to developers
Description: The entity shall provide guidelines to application developers on minimum requirements for validation checks for applications under development.

Name: Control of internal processing - Compliance
Description: The entity shall require application developers to provide evidence of compliance with minimum requirements.

Name: Control of internal processing - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review existing applications to ensure validation checks included during their development still met minimum requirements.

Name: Message integrity - Identify requirements
Description: The entity shall identify requirements to ensure authenticity and integrity of messages transmitted between systems and applications.

Name: Message integrity - Adopt controls
Description: The entity shall adopt proper controls to address the identified requirements.

Name: Output data validation - Output validation
Description: The entity shall define output validation procedures to ensure that the processing of stored information is correct and appropriate to the circumstances.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Document policy
Description: The entity shall develop and document a policy for the use of cryptographic controls in line with the criticality of the information to be protected.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Sector or national level restrictions
Description: The entity shall ensure the policy takes into account the sector or national level restrictions including 'UAE IA's relevant issuances and guidance in this regard.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Share policy
Description: The entity shall share the policy with relevant users.

Name: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls - Review and update policy
Description: The entity shall review and update the policy at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Key management - Develop policy
Description: The entity shall develop a key management policy and process to control the generation of keys taking into account UAE IA's issuances with regard to key management.

Name: Key management - Key storing standards
Description: The entity shall define key storing standards.

Name: Key management - Define procedures
Description: The entity shall define procedures to revoke/block keys and to repair damage or corrupted keys.

Name: Key management - Protect keys against loss
Description: The entity shall protect all cryptographic keys against modification and loss.

Name: Key management - Protect keys against disclosure
Description: The entity shall protect secret and private keys against unauthorized use and disclosure.

Name: Control of operational software - Installation of software
Description: The entity shall allow the installation of software only by authorized administrators.

Name: Control of operational software - Inhibit installation
Description: The entity shall inhibit installation of software by users, unless justified by their role/business need.

Name: Control of operational software - Original copy
Description: The entity shall keep an original copy of every installed software, including previous versions.

Name: Control of operational software - Rollback strategy
Description: The entity shall have a rollback strategy.

Name: Control of operational software - Audit log
Description: The entity shall have an audit log of all software installations.

Name: Protection of system test data - Sample data sets
Description: The entity shall use sample data sets to test data applications.

Name: Protection of system test data - Limit the transfer of data
Description: The entity shall limit the transfer of real data from production environment to the test environment, and to be done only after the appropriate authorization.

Name: Protection of system test data - Erase data
Description: The entity shall erase any data from test applications immediately after testing is completed.

Name: Protection of system test data - Track of copy/erase
Description: The entity shall keep track of any copy/erase of data between production and testing environment.

Name: Access control to program source code - Define policy
Description: The entity shall define an access control policy to source code.

Name: Access control to program source code - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall define and periodically review permissions.

Name: Access control to program source code - Audit log
Description: The entity shall keep an audit log of all accesses.

Name: Change control procedures - Develop procedure
Description: The entity shall develop a change control procedure.

Name: Change control procedures - Track record
Description: The entity shall keep track record of all changes.

Name: Change control procedures - Copy of every version
Description: The entity shall keep a copy of every version of the software, adopting appropriate integrity verification procedures.

Name: Change control procedures - Update documents
Description: The entity shall ensure all relevant documentations are up-to-date.

Name: Change control procedures - Proper planning
Description: The entity shall ensure proper planning to perform changes implementation at the right time.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Test applications
Description: The entity shall test any application in a testing environment when operating systems are changed (including patches and configurations).

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Monitoring
Description: The entity shall monitor operating system and application logs for any anomaly.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Rollback procedure
Description: The entity shall always define a rollback procedure.

Name: Technical review of applications after operating system changes - Asset database
Description: The entity shall ensure that changes are reflected in any asset database and in any technical contingency plan.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Approval of changes
Description: The entity shall define who is entitled to approve changes to software/applications.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Testing change
Description: The entity shall test any change in a testing environment before moving it to production environment.

Name: Restrictions of changes to software packages - Major changes
Description: The entity shall in case of major changes in critical software and applications, perform a Secure Code Review.

Name: Information leakage - Data leak prevention solution
Description: The entity shall Adopt Data Leak Prevention (DLP) measures.

Name: Information leakage - Access management solutions
Description: The entity shall adopt identity and access management solutions to limit access to critical data only to authorized personnel.

Name: Information leakage - Information classification policy
Description: The entity shall define and enforce a data/information classification policy.

Name: Outsourced software development - Security coding policy
Description: The entity shall define a secure coding policy.

Name: Outsourced software development - Quality assurance (QA) process
Description: The entity shall define a Quality Assurance (QA) process.

Name: Outsourced software development - Software acquisition contract
Description: The entity shall include in the software acquisition contract a clause to oblige third part to be compliant to Entity secure coding policy, to align to Entity QA process; contract shall also include the possibility to conduct audit on the third party.

Name: Outsourced software development - Software development contract
Description: The entity shall specify in the software development contract any requirement and information security functionality.

Name: Outsourced software development - Source code review
Description: The entity shall conduct a source code review to identify potential vulnerabilities and/or malicious code or code that does not conform to the functionalities required.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Vulnerabilities in new systems
Description: The entity shall identify vulnerabilities in new systems and applications and define a remediation plan before placing them in a production environment.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Production systems
Description: The entity shall test, review, check, and verify the presence of vulnerabilities in production systems throughout the development life-cycle, preferably by the use of automated testing tools.

Name: Control of technical vulnerabilities - Cost-Benefit-Analysis (CBA)
Description: The entity shall perform a Cost-Benefit-Analysis (CBA) for vulnerabilities to determine the proper remediation plan, where appropriate.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Define policy
Description: The entity shall define a policy to regulate the acquisition of products and services. Such a policy shall include not to disclose to the supplier any unnecessary details about the entity's configurations and architectures.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Compliance to security requirements
Description: The entity shall check for every product/service delivered its compliance to security requirements defined by the policy.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Contract
Description: The entity shall define in the contract with the supplier that compliance with the entity security policy is required.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Incentivize transparency
Description: The entity shall incentivize transparency into the security practices of the supplier.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Possibility to audit
Description: The entity shall include the possibility to audit the supplier's security practices.

Name: Supply chain protection strategy - Sector and national level requirements
Description: The entity shall ensure all sector and national level requirements for supply chain security are met.

Name: Supplier reviews - Evaluation process
Description: The entity shall define an evaluation process for suppliers of information systems, system components and services.

Name: Supplier reviews - Periodic review
Description: The entity shall periodically review supplier evaluations.

Name: Supplier reviews - Supplier review process
Description: The entity shall ensure the supplier review process includes checks with appropriate sector and national level requirements.

Name: Limitation of harm - Suppliers
Description: The entity shall limit information shared with suppliers.

Name: Limitation of harm - Diverse set of suppliers
Description: The entity shall employ a diverse set of suppliers for any critical information system product and service area.

Name: Supply chain operations security - Evaluate risks
Description: The entity shall evaluate risks to its own information systems/services operations considering also threats/vulnerabilities relate to suppliers.

Name: Supply chain operations security - Work with suppliers
Description: The entity shall work with suppliers to align controls and have them reported in the service contract.

Name: Supply chain operations security - Define monitoring of controls
Description: The entity shall define how controls implemented by suppliers will be monitored by the entity.

Name: Reliable delivery - Information systems and components
Description: The entity shall ensure information systems and components received are genuine.

Name: Reliable delivery - No alteration
Description: The entity shall verify software delivered has not being altered.

Name: Process to address weaknesses or deficiencies - Supply chain elements
Description: The entity shall map supply chain elements and identify any interdependency.

Name: Process to address weaknesses or deficiencies - Organizational assessments
Description: The entity shall identify and address any weaknesses or deficiencies during independent or organizational assessments of the mapped supply chain elements.

Name: Process to address weaknesses or deficiencies - Audit process
Description: The entity shall establish a formal review/audit process.

Name: Process to address weaknesses or deficiencies - Regular assessments
Description: The entity shall conduct regular assessments and audits of supply chain elements.

Name: Supply of critical information system components - Contingency plan
Description: The entity shall define contingency plan for any supply of critical information system component.

Name: Supply of critical information system components - Stockpiling
Description: The entity shall stockpiling of critical spare components.

Name: Supply of critical information system components - Multiple suppliers
Description: The entity shall use multiple suppliers for critical components.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The incident management policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Management commitment
Description: The incident management policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The incident management policy shall outline roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Framework
Description: The incident management policy shall provide the framework for managing incidents.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Address sector and national level requirements
Description: The incident management policy shall address sector and national level requirements for handling and reporting incidents.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Communicate
Description: The incident management policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The incident management policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Information security incident management policy - Management
Description: The incident management policy shall be maintained, reviewed, exercised and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Incident response plan - Develop a plan
Description: The entity shall develop an incident response plan encompassing processes and procedures for handling incidents before, during, and after an incident occurs to be documented, tested and maintained.

Name: Incident response plan - Communication plan
Description: The entity shall develop an incident response plan encompassing a communication plan to include internal and external parties.

Name: Incident response plan - Senior management approval
Description: The entity shall develop an incident response plan encompassing senior management approval of all plans and procedures.

Name: Incident response plan - Required resources and capabilities
Description: The entity shall develop an incident response plan encompassing the required resources and capabilities to be defined.

Name: Incident response plan -  Computer security incident response team
Description: The entity shall develop an incident response plan encompassing the establishment of a Computer Security Incident Response Team.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Stakeholders and participants.
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by identifying stakeholders and participants.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Funding
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by securing funding for CSIRT operations.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Level of services
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by deciding on the range and level of services the CSIRT will offer.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Reporting structure
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by determining the CSIRT reporting structure, authority, and organizational model.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Identify resources
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by identifying required resources such as staff, equipment, and infrastructure.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Interactions and interfaces
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by defining interactions and interfaces.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by defining roles, responsibilities, and the corresponding authority.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Workflow
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by documenting the workflow.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Develop policies and procedures
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by developing policies and corresponding procedures.

Name: Computer security incident response team - Awareness
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT by announcing the CSIRT when it becomes operational to create the appropriate level of awareness.

Name: Incident classification - Classification scheme
Description: The entity shall establish an incident classification scheme in line with the incident response policy taking into account UAE IA's issuances with regard to incident management.

Name: Incident classification - Identify incidents
Description: The entity shall assess and identify the incidents that should be reported at the sector and national level.

Name: Incident response training - Establish program
Description: The entity shall establish a training program for the cyber security incident response team (CSIRT), in line with the Awareness and Training Policy.

Name: Incident response training - Incident response procedures
Description: The entity shall ensure that the program covers all incident response procedures as well as their users.

Name: Incident response testing - Testing
Description: The entity shall develop testing procedures and cases to validate effectiveness and usefulness of its incident response capability.

Name: Incident response testing - Test results
Description: The entity shall establish expected test results.

Name: Incident response testing - Gaps and weaknesses
Description: The entity shall conduct incident response capability testing and compare outcome to the expected results to identify gaps and weaknesses for remediation.

Name: Incident response assistance - Assign resources
Description: Assign the appropriate resources needed to support employees and external parties in handling and reporting of security incidents.

Name: Incident response assistance - Procedure
Description: Establish and make available the procedure to get in touch with the assigned personnel.

Name: Information security incident documentation - Identify data
Description: The entity shall identify the relevant data to be collected before, during and after an information security incident takes place.

Name: Information security incident documentation - Collect data
Description: The entity shall collect and document relevant data related to all security incidents.

Name: Information security incident documentation - Protect documentation
Description: The entity shall protect the information security incident documentation.

Name: Learning from information security incidents - Establish records
Description: The entity shall establish detailed incident records including all related activities and outcomes where applicable.

Name: Learning from information security incidents - Develop lessons learned
Description: The entity shall develop lessons learned and where applicable identify additional controls to avoid similar incidents in the future.

Name: Collection of evidence - Identify requirements
Description: The entity shall identify the requirements of the applicable jurisdictions.

Name: Collection of evidence - Establish procedures
Description: The entity shall establish procedures for collecting evidence taking into account:  ' Chain of custody ' Safety of evidence ' Safety of the personnel ' Roles and responsibilities of personnel involved ' Competency of the personnel ' Documentation ' Briefing ' Other identified requirements

Name: Situational awareness - Identify priority information
Description: The entity shall identify priority information and share it internally to build the entity context.

Name: Situational awareness - Priority information
Description: The entity shall, for the sector context, identify and share priority information that is relevant to entities in the same sector to build the sector context.

Name: Situational awareness - Build national context.
Description: The entity shall, for the national context, identify and share priority information that is relevant across all sectors to build the national context.

Name: Reporting information security events - Point of contact
Description: The entity shall identify a designated event point of contact (e.g. CSIRT).

Name: Reporting information security events - Information security events reporting procedure
Description: The entity shall establish an information security events reporting procedure.

Name: Reporting information security events - Event communication
Description: The entity shall establish an event communication and reporting approach to the appropriate stakeholder (including appropriate authority).

Name: Reporting information security events - Sector and national level management channels
Description: The entity shall ensure the reporting approach accounts for all sector and national level management channels.

Name: Reporting security weaknesses - Procedure
Description: The entity shall establish and make available a procedure for employees and external third party users to report information security weaknesses as soon as identified.

Name: Reporting security weaknesses - Establish CSIRT
Description: The entity shall establish a CSIRT as a point of contact for any information security related issue.

Name: Reporting security weaknesses - No exploitation
Description: The entity shall ensure that no user is trying to exploit the weakness.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Appropriate policy
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall be appropriate to the purpose of the entity.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Management commitment
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall include statement of the management commitment, purpose, objective and scope of the policy.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall outline roles and responsibilities.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Framework
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall provide the framework for continuity of information in adverse situations in accordance with the entity overall business continuity and / or disaster recovery planning.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Communicate
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall be documented and communicated to all users.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Read and acknowledge
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall be read and acknowledged formally by all users.

Name: Information systems continuity management policy - Management
Description: The information systems continuity planning policy shall be maintained, reviewed, tested and updated at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

Name: Development of information continuity plans - Information continuity requirements
Description: The entity shall identify information continuity requirements in line with the entity's overall business continuity planning and / or disaster recovery.

Name: Development of information continuity plans - Escalations criteria
Description: The entity shall specify the escalations criteria and the conditions for its activation.

Name: Development of information continuity plans - Roles and responsibilities
Description: The entity shall outline information continuity roles and responsibilities, and assign individuals with contact information.

Name: Development of information continuity plans - Define a safe mode
Description: The entity shall define a safe mode when incidents are detected that restrict the entity's operation in accordance with the information systems continuity policy.

Name: Implementing information systems continuity plans - Establish capabilities
Description: The entity shall establish information systems continuity capabilities based on the established plans.

Name: Testing, maintaining, and reassessing information systems continuity plans - Periodic test
Description: The entity shall periodically test the continuity plan for the information systems following the established procedures to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the organizational readiness to execute the plan.

Name: Testing, maintaining, and reassessing information systems continuity plans - Lessons learned
Description: The entity shall establish lessons learned and update the information systems continuity plans to ensure they are always up-to-date.
